go_data.justification: CYP2R1 hydroxylates vitamin D2 and D3 at carbon 25 resulting in the production of 25(OH)D.
CYP2R1 catalyzes the generation of 25(OH)D from pro-vitamin D3 as a 25-hydroxylase.
CYP2R1 is a microsomal enzyme, indicating it is located in the endoplasmic reticulum.
CYP2R1 is expressed in the liver where it hydroxylates vitamin D2 and D3.
The placenta possesses CYP2R1, which may be involved in the regulation of circulating 25(OH)D levels.
